title: Addition on a Segment
statementHtml:
You start with an integer array aa, which initially consists of nn zeros. You have to perform the following action exactly nn times:

You are given an array bb, consisting of nn integers. Your task is to choose such values ll and rr for each action that:

What's the maximum possible value of r−l+1r−l+1?
inputSpecHtml:
Each test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases tt (1≤t≤1041≤t≤104). The description of the test cases follows.

The first line of each test case contains one integer nn (1≤n≤2⋅1051≤n≤2⋅105) — the length of the array bb.

The second line of each test case contains nn integers bibi (0≤bi≤n0≤bi≤n) — the elements of the array bb.

Additional constraints on the input:

  • there exists at least one way to choose ll and rr for each action and reorder the elements at the end so that aa becomes equal to bb;
  • the sum of nn over all test cases does not exceed 2⋅1052⋅105.
outputSpecHtml: For each test case, output one integer — the answer to the problem.
noteHtml:
Consider the first test case. If the nn actions were as follows:

  • l=3l=3 and r=3r=3
  • l=1l=1 and r=3r=3
  • l=3l=3 and r=3r=3
  • l=3l=3 and r=3r=3
  • l=3l=3 and r=3r=3

The array a=[1,1,5,0,0]a=[1,1,5,0,0], so you can reorder the elements to make it equal to [0,5,1,0,1][0,5,1,0,1]. As can be seen in this case, the maximum value of r−l+1r−l+1 is 33. It can be shown that this is the optimal answer.

In the second test case:

  • l=1l=1 and r=3r=3
  • l=2l=2 and r=3r=3
  • l=3l=3 and r=3r=3

The answer is 33.
